title: Coronation Street fans struggle to watch Sinead's harrowing final hours and sad goodbyes

Coronation Street aired harrowing scenes as they showed cancer-stricken Sinead Tinker's final hours, as she lost her battle with cancer.

Sinead had been diagnosed with cervical cancer while pregnant with baby son Bertie last year, but just weeks ago she learned it had returned and she was now terminal.

Friday's hard to watch episode, an hour-long special focusing on Sinead's final hours, showed distressing scenes detailing the character's suffering before she lost her life.

She was in and out of consciousness, speaking candidly about death with vicar Billy Mayhew and her husband Daniel Osbourne.

In her final moments, she listened to Daniel read their baby son a bedtime story before passing away.

(Image: ITV)

The episode didn't shy away from distressing scenes of Sinead dying, as she struggled to breathe and remain conscious before "feeling herself going".

Daniel begged her to stay awake for as long as she could, with her admitting she wasn't quite ready to leave.

Sinead said she wasn't scared of dying, it was the "leaving", wishing she could hold her baby son one last time.

(Image: ITV)

As the episode went on, viewers grew emotional and distressed by the difficult scenes, with many admitting they were struggling to watch - as others shared their own experiences of losing loved ones to illness.

The episode began with Daniel explaining it had been a bit of a rough night with Sinead in pain.

Daniel did his best to comfort her as the pain continued, and while the rest of the family felt helpless and didn't know what to do, Daniel remained calm - as the nurse reminded him he was "doing a great job".

(Image: ITV)

Each scene faded to black as she dipped in and out of consciousness.

As Daniel read their son a story to help him sleep, viewers knew the end was coming as Sinead's eyes began to close - and as he reached the end of the tale Sinead was finally at peace, with Daniel realising she had passed away.

Viewers took to Twitter to share their difficulty in watching the episode, while praising the cast and crew for the scenes.

(Image: ITV)

One fan said: "So tough to watch tonight but it is raising much needed awareness. Well done."

Another tweeted: "Coronation street really hitting home.. hard to watch, poor Sinead."

A third said: "Well this is grim #corrie as it should be. Beautifully done but very hard to watch."

Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
description: Coronation Street aired difficult scenes as Sinead Tinker's family said goodbye to her, as she lost her battle with cancer
